posts.name: Farhafarhi21
posts.cooked:
Hello,

I just received my DGX Spark yesterday and everything was working perfectly. I installed a 65GB LLM, but after rebooting, the system never fully started up again. It gets all the way to the GDM login service, shows everything as ‚Äú[OK]‚Äù in the boot messages, but then just hangs there indefinitely.

DGX1920√ó3413 667 KB

I have been troubleshooting this for hours, I tried:

  1. GRUB access - I can get to the boot menu, but when I try recovery mode or any of the advanced options, it still hangs at the same point.

  2. Serial console - I hooked up a serial cable and can see the boot messages, but once it hits GDM it stops responding. Ctrl+Alt+F2 just gives me a blinking cursor.

  3. Secure Boot - I was getting Secure Boot errors initially, but I disabled that in the BIOS. That got me past those errors, but the boot hang remains.

  4. NVIDIA recovery image - I downloaded the official DGX Spark recovery image (version 1.91.51) and created a bootable USB drive. The files look correct (has boot/, efi/, fw/ folders), but my system‚Äôs UEFI won‚Äôt detect it as a bootable device. I even tried manually adding a boot entry.

I just can‚Äôt go beyond this screen !

I was really excited to start working with this system and now I am just staring at a frozen boot screen.

@aplattner @aniculescu @NVES

Thanks

posts.name: ashreaperone
posts.cooked: This is absolutely frustrating. Just got mine this afternoon. Not booting‚Ä¶ just black screen. I have been waiting over an hour‚Ä¶üò°

posts.name: Farhafarhi21
posts.cooked: @ashreaperone , I agree, tried even reaching out to their support team as always they suggested to post here and hope atleast here, we will get some response.

posts.name: Aniculescu
posts.cooked:
Hi,

How did you create the bootable USB drive? We have our own tool to do it, did you follow the steps shown here to create it?

link_counts.title: System Recovery ‚Äî DGX Spark User Guide

posts.name: Farhafarhi21
posts.cooked: @aniculescu yes, I followed this guide and at step-6, they mentioned to select USB drive under ‚ÄúBoot Override‚Äù but I don‚Äôt see USB drive. I have only two options under boot override, UBUNTU (Samsung) and UEFI - PXE IPV4 realtex PCIe 10 GBE family contributor

posts.name: Aniculescu
posts.cooked: Please try to create the USB boot again. If it still does not work, you may need to try a different USB stick

posts.name: Farhafarhi21
posts.cooked:
@aniculescu Thank you for the USB suggestion. I wanted to clarify my current situation and seek your assistance on the best recovery path.

The boot failure occurs specifically at the GDM service after installing a large AI model. The system shows all services as [OK] until GDM starts, then hangs indefinitely.

My key question: Would you recommend attempting a system reflash, or are there less invasive troubleshooting steps I should try first?

posts.name: Marc
posts.cooked:
Just a heads-up:

It looks like in the DGX Spark Recovery Image, the CreateUSBKeyMacOS.sh script was moved out of the usbimg.customer/scripts folder, but the path inside the script wasn‚Äôt updated. The script still references /usbimg.customer/../usb instead of /usbimg.customer/usb, which causes it to fail on macOS with the error:

Install folder not found:

I was able to fix it by simply moving the script back into the scripts folder. This issue seems to affect only the CreateUSBKeyMacOS.sh script. The others seem to work fine.

posts.name: Aniculescu
posts.cooked: You can try accessing the system remotely via SSH. If you can connect would you be able to collect the complete output of journalctl and attach it here, or send it to us? If you can also run sudo nvidia-bug-report.sh and collect the log file from that, that would also be helpful.

posts.name: Sari Yono
posts.cooked:
BOOT LOOP ISSUE RESOLVED DGX Spark / GB10
Set mine up around 3 pm central time using network appliance method, unresponsive, not booting, hard power off. Connected an Apple USB C Keyboard and Trackpad (both work fine), used grub to launch recovery mode, purged broken packages, booting fine on 6.11.0-1014-nvidia.

posts.name: Farhafarhi21
posts.cooked:
Hello @aniculescu I am attempting to perform a factory recovery on my DGX Spark following the official documentation at https://docs.nvidia.com/dgx/dgx-spark/system-recovery.html. The recovery process fails consistently with the error:

WhatsApp Image 2025-10-19 at 17.43.49_f58ce32b1600√ó900 174 KB

The recovery process boots successfully from USB and displays the recovery menu. After selecting ‚ÄúSTART RECOVERY,‚Äù the system attempts to mount the USB device at /dev/sda1 but fails repeatedly after 10 attempts. The screen then freezes at the error message.

The DGX Spark has NVMe internal storage drives that are assigned /dev/sda, /dev/sdb, etc. during boot. This causes the USB recovery drive to be assigned a different device name (likely /dev/sdc1 or /dev/sdd1), but the recovery scripts appear to be hardcoded to look for /dev/sda1.

On my laptop, the same USB drive is correctly detected as /dev/sda1 and mounts properly, confirming the USB was created correctly.

I‚Äôve Tried:

  • Multiple USB drives (different brands/capacities)

  • SSD via USB adapter

  • Different USB ports on the hub

  • Recreating the recovery media multiple times

  • Complete power cycles of the DGX Spark

  • Verifying the USB partition structure (correct FAT32, bootable, proper label)

Kindly help, since 4-days, I am just trying to reflash.

Thanks

Farhana

link_counts.title: System Recovery ‚Äî DGX Spark User Guide

posts.name: Farhafarhi21
posts.cooked:
Following this post, I just used the same USB but this time instead of connecting through hub, I connected directly to DGX and it worked.

System Recovery - Failed to mount after 10 attempts DGX Spark / GB10
I waited for the fix overnight (thank you to the team(s) that helped resolve it) and then started the process here: System Recovery ‚Äî DGX Spark User Guide Things seemed fine until it started and now I see ‚ÄúFailed to mount after 10 attempts‚Äù. I‚Äô run through the steps again, resetting to factory defaults, ensure secure boot is enabled, restoring factory keys, and then booting from the USB. No luck. The reason I‚Äôm having to recover is that I was a victim of the ‚ÄúDO NOT ATTEMPT UPDATES OR SETUP‚Äù o‚Ä¶

Thanks

Farhana

link_counts.title: System Recovery - Failed to mount after 10 attempts
